Topic.Title: economic studies prove gov debt slows growth

Message.Msg: "keynesian nutjob Krugman tell us the opposite. " nope you are just a liar. Fact is all are quite clear that in the long term excessive debt is a drag on the economy and has to be dealt with, as per the CBO who say the same. The cbo has pointed out that the Obama stimulus added couple points to gdp growth and also cut UE by a couple of %. They are quite clear the long term debt must be dealt with, and they show that both parties have a plan that will accomplish putting USA debt on a sustainable path. Neo keynesians like Krugman (and Roubini) have voiced exactly the same. The cure to the depression (no demand) is stimulus, once the emergency is over, taxes can be raised and so forth to deal the the debt LONG TERM.

Topic.Title: db.. ffaces, reagan first 4 years jobless

Message.Msg: You are proving how ignorant you are. Reagan took office Jan-1981, U/E was 7.5%. During his first term it increased to over 10% but decreased to 7.4% in Oct-1984. And it continued to decrease to 5.4% by Jan-1989 when Reagan left office. Obama took office Jan-2009 with U/E at 7.8%. It increased to be over 10% then decreased to mid-8%s and has been in the mid-8%s ever since. During 2010 and 2011 the U/E rate AVERAGED around 9%. Obama's policies are a complete and total failure.

Topic.Title: economy is stonger than you think, so stop your hand wringing

Message.Msg: > The most dramatic signs of a US revival are in > manufacturing. It's bizarre that you fail to see that manufacturing bounced back slightly BECAUSE of the crisis and against all efforts of the government to go back to the previous orgy of non-productivity.

Topic.Title: economy is stonger than you think, so stop your hand wringing

Message.Msg: A new study from the McKinsey Global Institute shows that the United States is the only major developed economy that is even loosely following the path of countries that successfully negotiated similar debt-induced recessions, like Sweden and Finland in the 1990s. Total debt as a share of GDP has fallen since 2008 by 16 percent in the United States, while rising in Germany and rising sharply in Japan, the United Kingdom, France, Italy and Spain. =================================================== It's funny that this article cites as an advantage the fact of having been at the center of the previous crisis - while ignoring the fact that the US government is working hard to counteract this progress.

Topic.Title: economy is stonger than you think, so stop your hand wringing

Message.Msg: Yeah the economy is stronger, that's why it's turning for the worse. The economy can't survive on borrowed money, can't bring down the debt without jobs. False numbers and cherry coating the Obama effect is desperation and only goons buy it. Crackpots like messy deny the real state of things and believe whole heartedly, as the hitler youth, all the window dressing the media and lapdog economists are hanging out to get Obama re-elected. And yet he has nothing to show for 4 years of continuous blunders, they think he'll be better the 2nd time. Talk about Fantasy Island. Yeah, we sure need another 4 of this clown.

Message.Msg: that's what happens when close to 50% don't pay fed income tax. Obama is trying to buy off the election. These folks are not part of the welfare culture whereby everything they have is due to the gov. No. I don't think so.

Topic.Title: another big reason why Romney will win

Message.Msg: Regarding chick-fil-let, I was overjoyed when I read that the CFO's adolescent prank got him fired from his job. And the owners of chick-fil-let have been invited to open a branch in several cities. I laughed when I saw a lesbian holding a sign that read, "Don't eat hatefilled chicken" What disturbed loons. Their little rampage backfired. I love it. I salute all those good American who lined up to buy chick-fil-lets. I would have done it myself but the closest one is too far away.

Message.Title: Mitt the artful dodger? (LIAR)
Message.Msg: Romney's Un-Artful Tax Dodge Purposely Omits the Word "Income" in His Statement by David Zephyr "Let me also say, categorically, I have paid taxes every year. And a lot of taxes," candidate Romney declared. Well, EVERYONE pays "taxes every year". We all pay sales taxes and gasoline taxes. Romney did NOT say he has paid INCOME "taxes every year". Very revealing. Not an accident. He left the words "income" out of his denial. On purpose. By design. This guy is sweating like Nixon on this issue and is clearly hiding what he knows would appall Americans of all stripes. "I have paid taxes every year." Yeah, Mitt. So has everyone in America. But you didn't pay INCOME taxes every year.

Topic.Title: buying home beats renting in 3 years!

Message.Msg: worth repeating" "Zillow finds that in most of the U.S., buying becomes a better deal than renting after only three years of residence. In many metro areas, the advantage comes much sooner. In Miami, Fort Lauderdale, and Tampa, for example, owning beats renting after 1.6 years, the study finds. Zillow determined the breakeven horizon—the point at which owning becomes more financially advantageous than renting the same home--for more than 200 metro areas and 7,500 cities around the U.S. Unlike a simple purchase price-to-rent ratio, the breakeven horizon takes into account such other data as taxes, tax deductions, down payments, utilities, appreciation, maintenance, opportunity costs, and fluctuations in the rental market." Good Morning America

Message.Title: taxing the rich paid down USA debt
Message.Msg: just history folks: "The cost of World War II was financed primarily by a highly progressive Income Tax, as well as other taxes on corporations to prevent excess profits being derived from government contracts. Even the Vietnam War was largely financed by a surtax on incomes, paid largely by wealthier citizens rather than by the transfer of a payroll tax-generated social security Surplus to cover U.S. budget deficits. " and when did the trend of LOWER national debt each year after WW2 end?................. yep, Reagan turned that around! and he TRIPLED the nation's debts with his tax cuts and ENDED the entire post war history of a lower national debt each year.
